title: Task 42

question.text: How do Sarah's two actions of looking at the code and going back to an older version connect?

answers.answer: Looking was to find the problem; going back was for a new change.
answers.feedback: Both steps were to solve the issue, not for new changes.

answers.answer: Both were ways to try and solve the same problem.
Looking was for a report; going back was to solve the problem.
answers.feedback: Both steps were aimed at fixing the issue, not reporting.

answers.answer: Looking was her first try, and going back was not linked.
answers.feedback: Going back was related to her first step and part of trying to solve the issue.

dialogue.text: Well, I was investigating the code when I saw that the problem might be related to the recent updates.
I tried rolling back to the previous version, but it didn't fix the issue.

description: Understanding how different steps in solving a problem are connected is key.
